channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 2.3 million, US death toll approaching 40,000, Australia's death toll stands at 71

item.description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan have written to Britain's biggest tabloids, vowingÂ never to work with them again.
item.title: Prince Harry and wife Meghan blacklist British tabloids

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: A rise in house-bound Australians taking to their ovens has seen flour and other baking supplies fly off supermarket shelves.
item.title: Mills work overtime to keep up with flour demand as home bakers rise to the occasion

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Four children have been removed from alleged harm and three Victorian men charged during a global two-year long child abuse investigation spanning the United States to Australia.
item.title: Children 'rescued,' three Victorians arrested in alleged global child abuse ring bust

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: school resumes but most students will learn from home

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has hit Cricket Australia hard and that has caught the players by surprise, according to the star quick.
item.title: CA's dire financial state took players by surprise: Hazlewood

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: So far the state has detailed when and where 32 of the critical 98 fibres relating to this trial were found.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: State alleges blue fibres found on Ciara Glennon match accused's work trousers

item.description: While the new judges Melissa Leong, Jock Zonfrillo and Andy Allen have carved out a stylish look, their personalities and preferences are yet to shine through.
item.title: Three new judges step up to the plate as MasterChef undergoes a reset

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: A nightmare scenario of more than 58,000 Victorians contracting COVID-19 a day and 650 daily deaths has been avoided, Chief Health Officer says.
item.title: Victorians 'changed the future' by self isolating, Sutton says

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The number of passengers passing through Sydney Airport has crashed as travel restrictions to combat the coronavirus pandemic put the brakes on air travel.
item.title: Sydney Airport borrows $850 million as traffic sinks 97%

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Metcash is seeking to raise $330 million from investors, which will largely be used to pay down debt and help the company fun acquisitions.
item.title: Metcash in $330 million capital raising to drop debt and fund acquisitions

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: Within five days, the trio had created Crisis Heroes, a platform to connect strangers struggling in lockdown with those who could help them.
item.title: 'Some beautiful souls out there': mates' volunteer start-up makes global connections

item.description: A man wearing a police uniform has gone on a shooting rampage in Canada, killing more than a dozen people.
item.title: Police say mass shooting Canada's worst in recent history

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Matthew Anthony Russo was found by a housemate on the morning of his death with blood coming from his mouth, just hours after his last visit to a doctor.
item.title: North Queensland doctors referred to Ombudsman after coronial inquest

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Caltex's suitor, Alimentation Couche-Tard, has walked away from its $8.8 billion takeover offer for the Australian fuel supplier due to coronavirus uncertainty.
item.title: Caltex's $8.8b takeover talks end as virus clouds fuel sector

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Scientists have discovered the culprit who made marks on an ancient tooth, settling a major question over early Australian hunting practices.
item.title: Scientists get to the tooth of a 40,000-year-old whodunnit

item.description: Former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen believes the international game has lost its way and the coronavirus shutdown represents an opportunity to collaborate.
item.title: Rugby has 'a blank page' to shed self-interest: Hansen

item.description: Charles Leclerc won his second successive Formula One esports race with victory in a virtual Chinese Grand Prix, and then celebrated at home by cooking himself a plate of plain pasta.
item.title: Leclerc celebrates winning weekend with plain pasta

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Thunderstorms have dumped hail on the Capricornia and Central coast regions of Queensland on Sunday, with some places battered by stones the size of tennis balls.
item.title: Storms dump 'tennis ball, baseball' hailstones before cold snap rolls through

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: The fact you can't visit in person doesn't mean you can't enjoy some of Europe's finest galleries, as well as foreign-language films that cost nothing to watch.
item.title: Top fives: How to escape overseas from your living room

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: From pop/nu-metal to classical, our music critics review four new albums that have a multitude of tastes covered.
item.title: Who knew Korn-type metal could meld with pop? Rina Sawayama, that's who

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: The additional workloads and âimpossibleâ social distancing requirements have left teachers riled over the announcement, many seriously thinking about quitting the profession.
item.title: 'Let down, undervalued': A teacher's open letter to WA Premier on where he went wrong

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland has vowed to "stop at nothing" to keep Virgin's headquarters in Brisbane and has warned the NSW government to "back right off".
item.title: 'We will bring a bazooka': States in a bidding war for Virgin HQ

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: An infectious diseases expert from Perth has issued a stern warning against relaxing social distancing measures en masse, saying the decision to send kids back to school next week was âa bad oneâ.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Call to send WA children back to school 'a bad one', Perth expert claims

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: Why do epidemics breed conspiracy theories? And what do scientists say?
item.title: How conspiracy theories about COVID-19 went viral

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Market Wrap
item.title: Market Wrap: all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.description: Novak Djokovic is against any compulsory vaccinations for tennis players returning to the game after the coronavirus hiatus, and faces a dilemma if forced to do so himself.
item.title: No vax: Djokovic opposes coronavirus vaccination

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 is declining, down 1 per cent just before midday, as new economic data highlights the impact of the COVID-19 shutdown.
item.title: ASX trading lower as energy, financials drag

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: We delved into the archive and came up with Greg Baumâs report from the nail-biting 2012 Anzac Day classic at the MCG.
item.title: Footy flashback: Pressure, damp no obstacle for Pies, Bombers

item.description: Police said some of the gunmen wielded AK 47 guns in the attacks on villagers.
item.title: 'Armed bandits' kill dozens in north-west Nigeria

item.description: We've selected five of the best Anzac Day matches between Essendon and Collingwood since 1995. Now, it's time for you to decide which clash was the best of them all.
item.title: Anzac Day poll: Which of these classic matches was the best?

item.description: Caution urged as Victoria reports just one new COVID-19 case, as global death toll passes 162,000.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Incoming coach Ian Foster says the All Blacks cannot dwell on their World Cup exit as he takes over the top job from 2015 winner Steve Hansen.
item.title: 'England hurt, but we're excited about a new challenge'

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Police were called to bushland in Rockdale on Sunday night following concerns for welfare of a 51-year-old man.
item.title: Man shot dead in Sydney's south after allegedly threatening police

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has confirmed the state government is considering a bailout for Virgin Australia after the Treasurer revealed "significant discussions" with the airline.
item.title: NSW records six new coronavirus cases, including two at aged care facility

item.description: The virus-free bubble that the Costa Deliziosa cruise ship became on its 15-week odyssey is coming to an end.
item.title: 'A stroke of luck': Passenger glad to be on global cruise during pandemic

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Damaging winds will batter parts of Victoria and Melbourne's northern suburbs on Monday, with gusts of up to 100km/h.
item.title: Damaging winds batter Victoria, Melbourne's north

item.description: John Millman says years of 'top heavy prizemoney increases' have perpetuated inequality in tennis and should have been more evenly spread throughout the game.
item.title: 'Why has it taken a pandemic': Millman questions Djokovic rescue plan

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for flat open as focus shifts to US earnings

item.description: The agency's suspension came after an April 3 story cited multiple sources who said the government was misreporting coronavirus cases.
item.title: Iraq lifts Reuters news agency suspension over virus report

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Current and former cabinet ministers have rushed to defend Prime Minister Boris Johnson in the wake of damning claims.
item.title: British government on the defensive over claims Boris Johnson skipped coronavirus meetings

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The $55,000 direct breach of a board resolution that could spell the end for NRL chief executive Todd Greenberg.
item.title: The final straw: Why Vâlandys sided with NRL clubs over his own executive team

item.description: Antonio Guterres, the Secretary-General, has urged warring countries to declare a temporary truce and focus all their attention on fighting the virus.
item.title: Push for universal global ceasefire 'stalled by US and Russia'

item.description: Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Women have led the charge in spending one-off government stimulus payments during the past fortnight. And they've made different choices to male recipients.
item.title: Groceries vs video games: How women and men spend their stimulus payments differently

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Tony Abbott dismissed advice from Australia's top Defence official to admit his government could not meet its stated deadline for a new submarine fleet, sparking a clash on national security.
item.title: Tony Abbott dismissed official Defence advice on submarines, Turnbull claims

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: A real-time spending tracker shows higher income consumers have been scaling back spending since early March.
item.title: As high income shoppers cut back, the less well off spend up

item.description: We blame the captain when we find our modest paddle-steamer unable to weather a hurricane. But this UN agency's failings are by design.
item.title: We need Ghebreyesus to lead WHO through this crisis

item.description: As a teacher, I hoped the current break might give me some time to relax after teaching remotely but my stress levels are still up.
item.title: Risk illness or student disengagement: a teacher's dilemma

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: Local councillors say emergency powers given to mayors risk undermining democracy.
item.title: 'Unprecedented and very concerning': Concerns raised about COVID-19 powers given to mayors
